page.title: 02LOCHALSH PARISH CHURCH
page.content: A church has been recorded on this site from about 600 AD.At the time of its founding Lochalsh Church was in the Celtic sphere of influence.The present building was completed in 1641 and reroofed in 1791.The same slates are on the building today.The church has seating for some 300 people and over 30 children attend Sunday school. Six years ago a church hall was built 100yd to the west of the church.It has since had another room added.It is used for Brownies and Sunday school as well as by other organisations. A burial ground surrounds the Church. A new burial ground has recently been consecrated further west near Balmacara House. An ancient cemetery called "Cnoc-nan- Aingil" is on top of a knoll across the rood. It means "Hill of the Angel"
